bio.value:
[English] **George Keate** (b. 1729 in Trowbridge in Wiltshire, England, d. 1797 in 10 Charlotte Street, Bloomsbury, England), was a british lawyer, poet, naturalist, antiquary, painter and and writer.

[Deutsch] **George Keate** (geb. 1729 in Trowbridge in Wiltshire, England, gest. 1797 in 10 Charlotte Street, Bloomsbury, England), war ein britischer Jurist, Poet, Naturkundler, Historiker, Künstler, und Schriftsteller.

Literature
----------

- "Account Of George Keate Esq.", in: *The European magazine, and London Review : containing the Literature, History, Politics, Arts, Manners & Amusements of the Age* / by the Philological Society of London, vol. 32, July 1797; London : J. Sewell & J. Debrett, 1797, p. 20-23.
- "George Keate" [death notice], in: *The Gentleman's magazine and Historical Chronicle* : for the Year MDCCXCVII, Vol. LXVII, Pt. I, Nr. 6, June 1797 / by [Sylvanus Urban][1]; London : pr. by J. Nichols, sold by E. Newbery, 1797, p. 535.
- "Keate, Mr.", in: *The Gentleman's magazine and Historical Chronicle* : for the Year MDCCXCVII, Vol. LXVII, Pt. II, Nr. 1+3, Sept. 1797 / by [Sylvanus Urban][2]; London : printed by John Nichols, sold by Elizabeth Newbery, 1797, p. 613 (acct. of), 796 (his family and writings).
- "Keate (George)", in: *A new biographical Dictionary : containing a brief Account of the Lives and Writings of the eminent Persons and remarkable Characters in every Age and Nation* / by [Stephen Jones][3], 4th ed., corr., with num. Add., London, pr. by T. Benley, for G. and J. Robinson [etc.], 1802, p. JUV-KEI.
- "KEATE, [George]", in: *Das gelehrte England : oder Lexikon der jetzlebenden Schriftsteller in Grossbritannien, Irland und Nord-Amerika, nebst einem Verzeichniss ihrer Schriften vom Jahr 1770 bis 1790; Nachtrag und Fortsetzung vom Jahr 1790 bis 1803* [= *Alphabetical register of all the authors actually living in Great Britain, Ireland and in the Provinces of North America, etc.*] / von [Jeremias David Reuss][4], Th. I, A-K; Berlin & Stettin : F. Nicolai, 1804, p. 564.
- "Keate, George", in: *Bibliotheca Britannica : or a general index to British and foreign Literature* / by Robert Watt, ..., in 2 Parts; Vol. II, Authors; Edinburgh : A. Constable & Co., [etc.], 1824, c. 563.
- "Keate, George", in: *A universal biographical Dictionary : containing the lives of the most celebrated Characters of every Age and Nation, ...* / [by [Charles N. Baldwin][5] and Henry Howland Crapo]; New York : [s.n.], 1825, p. 266.
- "Keate, George", in: *Lempriére's biographical Dictionary : or, Sketches of the lives of the most celebrated Characters of every Age and Nation, ...* / [by [John Lemprière][6]; Richmond, VA : N. White, 1826, p. 266.
- "Keate, George", in: *Universal historical Dictionary : or Explanation of the Names of Persons and Places ...* / by [George Crabb][7], ..., enl. ed., in 2 vols., Vol. II; London : Baldwin and Cradock, and for J. Jowding, 1833, p. KAY-KEI [214].
- "Keate (George)", in: *A new biographical Dictionary: containing a brief Account of the most eminent Persons and remarkable Characters in every Age and Nation* / by [Stephen Jones][8], 8th ed., with additions and improvem.; London : Longman, Orme & Co., [etc.], 1840, p. 262.
- "George Keate (1729-1797)" in: *Spenser and the Tradition : English Poetry 1579-1830* [online] / compiled by David H. Radcliffe; Blacksburg, Va., USA, [n.d.]
- "George Keate". (2011, October 20) / by Wikipedia contributors, in: *Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia*. Retrieved 10:14, October 31, 2011 [see external links].


  [1]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL3454259A/ "Sylvanus Urban in the Open Library"
  [2]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL3454259A/ "Sylvanus Urban in the Open Library"
  [3]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL6021312A/ "Stephen Jones in the Open Library"
  [4]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL5231710A/ "Jeremias David Reuss in the Open Library"
  [5]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL6066277A/ "Charles N. Baldwin in the Open Library"
  [6]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL1349844A/ "John Lemprière in the Open Library"
  [7]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL1332125A/ "George_Crabb in the Open Library"
  [8]: http://openlibrary.org/authors/OL6021312A/ "Stephen Jones in the Open Library"
